title: Reviewing MKBHD Videos!
description: Working back to my first video, trying to survive the cringe   The Masterclass:   Why Don't People Buy Sony Smartphones?  Samsung Galaxy Fold Unboxing  HTC U Ultra Rant  Talking Tech with Kobe Bryant  The Dream Smartphone 2014  Update 1.0 = Video 100!  HP Pavilion dv7t Media Center Remote   MKBHD Merch:   Intro Track: Channel 41 by Deadmau5 Playlist of MKBHD Intro music:   ~
transcript: (upbeat music) - So on one hand, it's nice that you can look back at your previous work and see a difference and actually know that you're getting better at something. But on the other hand, it is kind of embarrassing when all that old stuff is still up and it's just not good. But I've been making videos more or less for about 13 years or almost 14 years now, which is crazy to say out loud. But the thing that I think I'm most proud of as far as the video-making process is that pretty much all of it is self taught. There is no how-to guide for creating a tech channel and making videos and making a business out of it until now. We basically have created the blueprint. I got to basically crystallize this blueprint in the form of a master class. I actually got to make a master class, which is pretty amazing. It's in pretty special company. I mean, I've watched Neil deGrasse Tyson's master class and I got to talk to him in person. We just watched Steph Curry win an NBA championship with the Warriors and he did a master class. And so to celebrate, I'm gonna go back and look at my older videos. Or at least, I'll go back in time slowly and try to survive the cringe. This is a Sony Xperia I ii. Reviews of smartphones has become the bread and butter of the channel. But these videos average more views per video about the phone than any other brand. The other one being that it's $1500. It's frustrating because it seems like Sony's suffering from some of the same stuff LG has, lately anyway, which is they're inability to-- RIP LG.
